summary: In this context, ethylbenzene is identified as a compound that can induce neurotoxicity and ototoxicity in rats upon inhalation. The mention of ethylbenzene's ototoxic effects highlights its potential to cause damage to the auditory system, linking it directly to the concept of ototoxicity. This relationship is part of a broader discussion on the toxicological impacts of BTEX compounds, including ethylbenzene.
